name: GMRA (Global Master Repurchase Agreement)
use_case: Extraction of clauses, datapoints and management of amendments for GMRA agreements
description: Global Master Repurchase Agreement. The GMRA is a standardized legal contract used in the repurchase agreement (repo) market, which is a form of short-term borrowing for dealers in government securities. The GMRA outlines the terms and conditions under which one party agrees to sell securities to another party with the agreement to repurchase them at a later date, typically at a higher price. This schedule includes specific details such as the parties involved, the types of securities that can be used, the terms of the repurchase agreements, and other relevant provisions.
